trans-unit.source: Customize HDInsight Clusters using script actions | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Customize HDInsight Clusters using script actions | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight provides a configuration option called Script Action that invokes custom scripts, which define the customization to be performed on the cluster during the provision process.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight provides a configuration option called Script Action that invokes custom scripts, which define the customization to be performed on the cluster during the provision process.

trans-unit.source: These scripts can be used to install additional software on a cluster, or to change the configuration of applications on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: These scripts can be used to install additional software on a cluster, or to change the configuration of applications on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: The information in this article is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The information in this article is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For a version of this article that is specific to Windows-based clusters, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action (Windows)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a version of this article that is specific to Windows-based clusters, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action (Windows)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Script Action is only used while a clusters is in the process of being created.
trans-unit.target: Script Action is only used while a clusters is in the process of being created.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates when Script Action is executed during the provision process:
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates when Script Action is executed during the provision process:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight cluster customization and stages during cluster provisioning</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight cluster customization and stages during cluster provisioning</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The script is ran while HDInsight is being configured.
trans-unit.target: The script is ran while HDInsight is being configured.

trans-unit.source: At this stage, the script is run in parallel on all the specified nodes in the cluster, and is ran with root privileges on the nodes.
trans-unit.target: At this stage, the script is run in parallel on all the specified nodes in the cluster, and is ran with root privileges on the nodes.

trans-unit.source: Because you have root privileges on the cluster nodes when the script is ran, you can perform operations like stopping and starting services, including Hadoop-related services.
trans-unit.target: Because you have root privileges on the cluster nodes when the script is ran, you can perform operations like stopping and starting services, including Hadoop-related services.

trans-unit.source: If you stop services, you must ensure that the Ambari service and other Hadoop-related services are up and running before the script finishes running.
trans-unit.target: If you stop services, you must ensure that the Ambari service and other Hadoop-related services are up and running before the script finishes running.

trans-unit.source: These services are required to successfully ascertain the health and state of the cluster while it is being created.
trans-unit.target: These services are required to successfully ascertain the health and state of the cluster while it is being created.

trans-unit.source: Each cluster can accept multiple script actions that are invoked in the order in which they are specified.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster can accept multiple script actions that are invoked in the order in which they are specified.

trans-unit.source: A script can be ran on the head nodes, the worker nodes, or both.
trans-unit.target: A script can be ran on the head nodes, the worker nodes, or both.

trans-unit.source: Script actions must complete within 15 minutes, or they will timeout.
trans-unit.target: Script actions must complete within 15 minutes, or they will timeout.

trans-unit.source: Script Action scripts can be used from the Azure Preview Portal, Azure PowerShell, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Script Action scripts can be used from the Azure Preview Portal, Azure PowerShell, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to use Script Action from the portal.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to use Script Action from the portal.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to use PowerShell and .NET SDK to use Script Action, look at the samples listed in the table below.
trans-unit.target: To learn how to use PowerShell and .NET SDK to use Script Action, look at the samples listed in the table below.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight provides several scripts to install the following components on HDInsight clusters:
trans-unit.target: HDInsight provides several scripts to install the following components on HDInsight clusters:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Script
trans-unit.target: Script

trans-unit.source: Install Hue
trans-unit.target: Install Hue

trans-unit.source: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv01/install-hue-uber-v01.sh.
trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxhueconfigactionv01/install-hue-uber-v01.sh.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Hue on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Hue on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Install Spark
trans-unit.target: Install Spark

trans-unit.source: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsparkconfigactionv01/spark-installer-v01.sh.
trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsparkconfigactionv01/spark-installer-v01.sh.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Install R
trans-unit.target: Install R

trans-unit.source: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxrconfigactionv01/r-installer-v01.sh.
trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxrconfigactionv01/r-installer-v01.sh.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use R on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use R on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Install Solr
trans-unit.target: Install Solr

trans-unit.source: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsolrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.sh.
trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsolrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.sh.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Solr on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Solr on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Install Giraph
trans-unit.target: Install Giraph

trans-unit.source: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh.
trans-unit.target: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxgiraphconfigactionv01/giraph-installer-v01.sh.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Giraph on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Giraph on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Start provisioning a cluster as described at <linkText>Provisioning a cluster using custom options</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Start provisioning a cluster as described at <linkText>Provisioning a cluster using custom options</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Under Optional Configuration, for the Script Actions blade, click add script action to provide details about the script action, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Under Optional Configuration, for the Script Actions blade, click add script action to provide details about the script action, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use Script Action to customize a cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use Script Action to customize a cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: | Property | Value | | -------- | ----- | | Name | Specify a name for the script action.
trans-unit.target: | Property | Value | | -------- | ----- | | Name | Specify a name for the script action.

trans-unit.source: | | Script URI | Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.
trans-unit.target: | | Script URI | Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.

trans-unit.source: | | Head/Worker | Specify the nodes (Head, Worker, or ZooKeeper) on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: | | Head/Worker | Specify the nodes (Head, Worker, or ZooKeeper) on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: | | Parameters | Specify the parameters, if required by the script.
trans-unit.target: | | Parameters | Specify the parameters, if required by the script.

trans-unit.source: Press ENTER to add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Press ENTER to add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click Select to save the script action configuration and continue with cluster provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Click Select to save the script action configuration and continue with cluster provisioning.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we use Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates to provision an HDInsight cluster and also use a script action to install custom components (R, in this example) on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we use Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates to provision an HDInsight cluster and also use a script action to install custom components (R, in this example) on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This section provides a sample ARM template to provision a cluster using script action.
trans-unit.target: This section provides a sample ARM template to provision a cluster using script action.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Powershell cmdlets, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Powershell cmdlets, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to create ARM templates, see <linkText>Authoring Azure Resource Manager templates</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to create ARM templates, see <linkText>Authoring Azure Resource Manager templates</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you have not previously used Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not previously used Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Copy the following template to a location on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Copy the following template to a location on your computer.

trans-unit.source: This template installs R on headnode as well as worker nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This template installs R on headnode as well as worker nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can also verify if the JSON template is valid.
trans-unit.target: You can also verify if the JSON template is valid.

trans-unit.source: Paste your template content into <linkText>JSONLint</linkText><title></title>, an online JSON validator tool.
trans-unit.target: Paste your template content into <linkText>JSONLint</linkText><title></title>, an online JSON validator tool.

trans-unit.source: Start Azure PowerShell and Log in to your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Start Azure PowerShell and Log in to your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: After providing your credentials, the command returns information about your account.
trans-unit.target: After providing your credentials, the command returns information about your account.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Azure Resource Manager module.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Azure Resource Manager module.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the resource group and location that you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the resource group and location that you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A summary of the new resource group is returned.
trans-unit.target: A summary of the new resource group is returned.

trans-unit.source: To create a new deployment for your resource group, run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command and provide the necessary parameters.
trans-unit.target: To create a new deployment for your resource group, run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command and provide the necessary parameters.

trans-unit.source: The parameters will include a name for your deployment, the name of your resource group, and the path or URL to the template you created.
trans-unit.target: The parameters will include a name for your deployment, the name of your resource group, and the path or URL to the template you created.

trans-unit.source: If your template requires any parameters, you must pass those parameters as well.
trans-unit.target: If your template requires any parameters, you must pass those parameters as well.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the script action to install R on the cluster does not require any parameters.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the script action to install R on the cluster does not require any parameters.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to provide values for the parameters defined in the template.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to provide values for the parameters defined in the template.

trans-unit.source: When the resource group has been deployed, you will see a summary of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: When the resource group has been deployed, you will see a summary of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: If your deployment fails, you can use the following cmdlets to get information about the failures.
trans-unit.target: If your deployment fails, you can use the following cmdlets to get information about the failures.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about the deployment failures, use the following cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about the deployment failures, use the following cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we use the Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet to invoke scripts by using Script Action to customize a cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we use the Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet to invoke scripts by using Script Action to customize a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Before proceeding, make sure you have installed and configured Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Before proceeding, make sure you have installed and configured Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Powershell cmdlets, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Powershell cmdlets, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console and declare the following variables:
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console and declare the following variables:

trans-unit.source: Specify the configuration values (such as nodes in the cluster) and the default storage to be used.
trans-unit.target: Specify the configuration values (such as nodes in the cluster) and the default storage to be used.

trans-unit.source: Use Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet to invoke the script.
trans-unit.target: Use Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet to invoke the script.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses the the script to install R on the cluster:
trans-unit.target: The following example uses the the script to install R on the cluster:

trans-unit.source: The Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet takes the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: The Add-AzureHDInsightScriptAction cmdlet takes the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: | Parameter | Definition | | --------- | ---------- | | Config | Configuration object to which script action information is added.
trans-unit.target: | Parameter | Definition | | --------- | ---------- | | Config | Configuration object to which script action information is added.

trans-unit.source: | | Name | Name of the script action.
trans-unit.target: | | Name | Name of the script action.

trans-unit.source: | | ClusterRoleCollection | Specifies the nodes on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: | | ClusterRoleCollection | Specifies the nodes on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: The valid values are HeadNode (to install on the head node), WorkerNode (to install on all the data nodes), or ZookeeperNode (to install on the zookeeper node).
trans-unit.target: The valid values are HeadNode (to install on the head node), WorkerNode (to install on all the data nodes), or ZookeeperNode (to install on the zookeeper node).

trans-unit.source: You can use either or all values.
trans-unit.target: You can use either or all values.

trans-unit.source: | | Parameters | Parameters required by the script.
trans-unit.target: | | Parameters | Parameters required by the script.

trans-unit.source: | | Uri | Specifies the URI to the script that is executed.
trans-unit.target: | | Uri | Specifies the URI to the script that is executed.

trans-unit.source: Finally, provision the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Finally, provision the cluster:

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the credentials for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the credentials for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes before the cluster is created.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes before the cluster is created.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides client libraries that makes it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET application.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides client libraries that makes it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET application.

trans-unit.source: The following steps demonstrate how to use a script to customize a cluster from the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: The following steps demonstrate how to use a script to customize a cluster from the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: You must first create a self-signed certificate, install it on your workstation, and then upload it to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: You must first create a self-signed certificate, install it on your workstation, and then upload it to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Create a self-signed certificate</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Create a self-signed certificate</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013 or 2015.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013 or 2015.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click New, and then click Project.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click New, and then click Project.

trans-unit.source: From New Project, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From New Project, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: | Property | Value | | -------- | ----- | | Category | Templates/Visual C#/Windows | | Template | Console Application | | Name | ScriptActionCluster |
trans-unit.target: | Property | Value | | -------- | ----- | | Category | Templates/Visual C#/Windows | | Template | Console Application | | Name | ScriptActionCluster |

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the Tools menu, click Nuget Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: From the Tools menu, click Nuget Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command in the console to install the package.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command in the console to install the package.

trans-unit.source: This command adds the .NET libraries and references to them from the current Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: This command adds the .NET libraries and references to them from the current Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double-click Program.cs to open it.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double-click Program.cs to open it.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to the top of the file:

trans-unit.source: In the Main() function, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables :
trans-unit.target: In the Main() function, paste the following code, and provide values for the variables :

trans-unit.source: Append the following code to the Main() function.
trans-unit.target: Append the following code to the Main() function.

trans-unit.source: This code invokes a Script Action; in this example, the script to install R on the cluster:
trans-unit.target: This code invokes a Script Action; in this example, the script to install R on the cluster:

trans-unit.source: Finally, create the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Finally, create the cluster:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the application and build the solution.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the application and build the solution.

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console, navigate to the location where you saved the project, navigate to the \bin\debug directory within the project, and then run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console, navigate to the location where you saved the project, navigate to the \bin\debug directory within the project, and then run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Provide a cluster name and press ENTER to provision a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Provide a cluster name and press ENTER to provision a cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure HDInsight service is a flexible platform that enables you to build big-data applications in the cloud by using an ecosystem of open-source technologies formed around Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure HDInsight service is a flexible platform that enables you to build big-data applications in the cloud by using an ecosystem of open-source technologies formed around Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure provides a general level of support for open-source technologies, as discussed in the Support Scope section of the Azure Support FAQ website.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure provides a general level of support for open-source technologies, as discussed in the Support Scope section of the Azure Support FAQ website.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight service provides an additional level of support for some of the components, as described below.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight service provides an additional level of support for some of the components, as described below.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of open-source components that are available in the HDInsight service:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of open-source components that are available in the HDInsight service:

trans-unit.source: Built-in components - These components are pre-installed on HDInsight clusters and provide core functionality of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Built-in components - These components are pre-installed on HDInsight clusters and provide core functionality of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, YARN ResourceManager, the Hive query language (HiveQL), and the Mahout library belong to this category.
trans-unit.target: For example, YARN ResourceManager, the Hive query language (HiveQL), and the Mahout library belong to this category.

trans-unit.source: A full list of cluster components is available in <linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A full list of cluster components is available in <linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Custom components - You, as a user of the cluster, can install or use in your workload any component available in the community or created by you.
trans-unit.target: Custom components - You, as a user of the cluster, can install or use in your workload any component available in the community or created by you.

trans-unit.source: Built-in components are fully supported, and Microsoft Support will help to isolate and resolve issues related to these components.
trans-unit.target: Built-in components are fully supported, and Microsoft Support will help to isolate and resolve issues related to these components.

trans-unit.source: Custom components receive commercially reasonable support to help you to further troubleshoot the issue.
trans-unit.target: Custom components receive commercially reasonable support to help you to further troubleshoot the issue.

trans-unit.source: This might result in resolving the issue or asking you to engage available channels for the open-source technologies where deep expertise for that technology is found.
trans-unit.target: This might result in resolving the issue or asking you to engage available channels for the open-source technologies where deep expertise for that technology is found.

trans-unit.source: For example, there are many community sites that can be used, like:
trans-unit.target: For example, there are many community sites that can be used, like:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MSDN forum for HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MSDN forum for HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Stack Overflow</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Stack Overflow</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Also, Apache projects have project sites on <linkText>Apache.org</linkText><title></title>; for example, <linkText>Hadoop</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Spark</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Also, Apache projects have project sites on <linkText>Apache.org</linkText><title></title>; for example, <linkText>Hadoop</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Spark</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight service provides several ways to use custom components.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight service provides several ways to use custom components.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of how a component is used or installed on the cluster, the same level of support applies.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of how a component is used or installed on the cluster, the same level of support applies.

trans-unit.source: Below is a list of the most common ways that custom components can be used on HDInsight clusters:
trans-unit.target: Below is a list of the most common ways that custom components can be used on HDInsight clusters:

trans-unit.source: Job submission - Hadoop or other types of jobs that execute or use custom components can be submitted to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Job submission - Hadoop or other types of jobs that execute or use custom components can be submitted to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster customization - During cluster creation, you can specify additional settings and custom components that will be installed on the cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: Cluster customization - During cluster creation, you can specify additional settings and custom components that will be installed on the cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: Samples - For popular custom components, Microsoft and others may provide samples of how these components can be used on the HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Samples - For popular custom components, Microsoft and others may provide samples of how these components can be used on the HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: These samples are provided without support.
trans-unit.target: These samples are provided without support.

trans-unit.source: You can use Ambari web UI to view information logged by scripts during cluster provisioning.
trans-unit.target: You can use Ambari web UI to view information logged by scripts during cluster provisioning.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, navigate to https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, navigate to https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin account name (admin) and password for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin account name (admin) and password for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You may have to re-enter the admin credentials in a web form.
trans-unit.target: You may have to re-enter the admin credentials in a web form.

trans-unit.source: From the bar at the top of the page, select the ops entry.
trans-unit.target: From the bar at the top of the page, select the ops entry.

trans-unit.source: This will show a list of current and previous operations performed on the cluster through Ambari.
trans-unit.target: This will show a list of current and previous operations performed on the cluster through Ambari.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Ambari web UI bar with ops selected</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Ambari web UI bar with ops selected</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Find the entries that have run\_customscriptaction in the Operations column.
trans-unit.target: Find the entries that have run\_customscriptaction in the Operations column.

trans-unit.source: These are created when the Script Actions are ran.
trans-unit.target: These are created when the Script Actions are ran.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of operations</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of operations</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select this entry, and drill down through the links to view the STDOUT and STDERR output generated when the script was ran on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select this entry, and drill down through the links to view the STDOUT and STDERR output generated when the script was ran on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: See the following for information and examples on creating and using scripts to customize a cluster:
trans-unit.target: See the following for information and examples on creating and using scripts to customize a cluster:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Develop Script Action scripts for HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Develop Script Action scripts for HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install and use R on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>
